title: Insider: Patriots probably won’t make a ‘Micah Parsons-type’ trade this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are unlikely to trade significant draft assets for a star player this offseason, according to ESPN's Mike Reiss.
New England has shown interest in Eagles' A.J. Brown and Raiders' Maxx Crosby, but both require substantial trade packages.
Patriots have 11 draft picks for 2026, mostly in later rounds, and $40 million in cap space for free agency.

title: Largest energy storage facility statewide gets approved for construction in Everett
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jupiter Power gains approval to build Massachusetts' largest battery energy storage facility in Everett on a former ExxonMobil site.
The facility will feature 816 enclosures for lithium-ion batteries and include two substations connected to Eversource Mystic Substation.
The Everett project is part of a larger development including lab, office, manufacturing, retail, and residential spaces in the 'Docklands' area.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Connor Storrie hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Connor Storrie hosted 'SNL' with musical guest Mumford & Sons on February 28, 2026.
Hudson Williams joined Storrie in sketches, highlighting their roles as hockey stars in 'Heated Rivalry'.
US Olympic hockey team members appeared during the monologue, featuring gold medalists Jack and Quinn Hughes.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s loss against the Red Bulls
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The New England Revolution lost 1-0 to the New York Red Bulls at Sports Illustrated Stadium on Saturday.
Brayan Ceballos and Mamadou Fofana returned to strengthen the Revolution's defense, holding firm despite New York's possession dominance.
The Revolution struggled offensively, failing to convert key opportunities, led by an ineffective press from the Red Bulls.

title: Triston Casas reportedly unlikely to be ready by Opening Day, while Kutter Crawford, Patrick Sandoval take step forward in rehab
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Triston Casas is unlikely to be ready for Opening Day due to his continued recovery from a torn patellar tendon.
Kutter Crawford and Patrick Sandoval threw live batting practice as they continue their rehabilitation from previous injuries.
Both Crawford and Sandoval are hopeful but uncertain about being ready for Opening Day, lacking clear roles on the roster.

title: Chicopee installs security cameras on school bus stop arms to enforce illegal passing laws
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Chicopee installs security cameras on school buses to address illegal passing by vehicles when stop arms are extended.
The cameras activate automatically, capturing evidence of violations to enforce laws without police presence.
The initiative, in partnership with BusPatrol, costs nothing to the city, school district, or taxpayers.

title: Review and setlist: Chris Stapleton brings the blues to Mohegan Sun Arena
author: Chris Stevens
bullets: Chris Stapleton performed to a sold-out crowd at Mohegan Sun Arena with a tight eight-piece band.
The setlist included hits like 'Tennessee Whiskey', 'Traveller', and a surprise cover of Lynyrd Skynyrd's 'Free Bird'.
Stapleton's performance featured a mix of blues and ballads, with standout contributions from legendary pedal steel player Paul Franklin.

title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Stefon Diggs could be a cut candidate for Patriots, potentially saving $16.8 million against the cap.
Decisions loom for New England on wide receivers DeMario Douglas, Mack Hollins, and Kayshon Boutte.
Christian Barmore's future in Foxborough uncertain due to ongoing legal issues and potential trade opportunities.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not return for the Celtics' game against the 76ers due to a right Achilles injury.
Joel Embiid will miss Sunday's game for the 76ers with an oblique strain, sidelining him for three games.
The Celtics, currently second in the East, have a 1-2 record against sixth-place Philadelphia this season.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran hit two home runs against the Twins, totaling three in the first week of spring training.
Duran's improved performance against left-handers contrasts with his .232 career batting average against them.
Duran may secure a spot in the Red Sox lineup as designated hitter due to his spring training success.
